page.title: 15FAMILY BACKGROUNDS
page.content: The survey was designed to portray the family backgrounds of pupils in a rural area. Gillingham and Shaftesbury have seen their populations more than double in the last ten years. Indeed it is becoming increasingly rare to hear a real Dorset accent. This influx of people from outside the area was reflected in the birth places of the children's parents, only one quarter of the class of twenty actually had parents born in Gillingham. The statistics also proved, however, how popular this area is as a place to live. Once settled here it seems that people are very reluctant to move. Those with city backgrounds see the area as an ideal environment in which to bring up their children.
